Sentencas: The influence of the operational conditions and the electrode material on the degradation induced by the model tar naphthalene on 10 x 10 cm2 fuel-electrode supported solid oxide cells operated on artificial bio-syngas under internal reforming conditions is experimentally investigated.
Titulo: Experimental Investigation of Naphthalene Induced Degradation of Reversible Solid Oxide Cells Operated on Bio-Syngas

Sentencas: Two different fuel electrodes are investigated based on yttrium-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) and gadolinium-doped ceria (GDC).
Titulo: Experimental Investigation of Naphthalene Induced Degradation of Reversible Solid Oxide Cells Operated on Bio-Syngas

Sentencas: A parameter study of the operational temperature and the operation mode (fuel cell or electrolysis mode) is conducted with the YSZ-based fuel electrode to quantify the effects on the cell degradation.
Titulo: Experimental Investigation of Naphthalene Induced Degradation of Reversible Solid Oxide Cells Operated on Bio-Syngas

Sentencas: The fuel off-gas composition and electrochemical impedance spectra are used to characterize the cell prior to the experiment and monitor its performance during the poisoning process.
Titulo: Experimental Investigation of Naphthalene Induced Degradation of Reversible Solid Oxide Cells Operated on Bio-Syngas

Sentencas: The influence of the tar on the Ni-YSZ electrode cell is investigated for an operation at 700 degrees C and 800 degrees C in fuel cell mode, and an operation at 700 degrees C in electrolysis mode.
Titulo: Experimental Investigation of Naphthalene Induced Degradation of Reversible Solid Oxide Cells Operated on Bio-Syngas

Sentencas: The experiment at 700 degrees C is repeated with the Ni-GDC electrode cell.
Titulo: Experimental Investigation of Naphthalene Induced Degradation of Reversible Solid Oxide Cells Operated on Bio-Syngas

Sentencas: At the increased operational temperature, the Ni-YSZ cell is more robust but carbon depositions occur.
Titulo: Experimental Investigation of Naphthalene Induced Degradation of Reversible Solid Oxide Cells Operated on Bio-Syngas

Sentencas: The voltage degradation during electrolysis operation increases significantly compared to fuel cell operation.
Titulo: Experimental Investigation of Naphthalene Induced Degradation of Reversible Solid Oxide Cells Operated on Bio-Syngas

Sentencas: The Ni-GDC electrode does not show an increased robustness compared to the Ni-YSZ electrode.
Titulo: Experimental Investigation of Naphthalene Induced Degradation of Reversible Solid Oxide Cells Operated on Bio-Syngas

Sentencas: Electrolysis mode is more vulnerable towards naphthalene than the fuel cell modePrototype of gadolinium-doped ceria electrode on Ni-YSZ substrate testedNo increased robustness towards the tar detected for the prototypeCarbon depositions and increased electrochemical robustness at 800 degrees C observed
Titulo: Experimental Investigation of Naphthalene Induced Degradation of Reversible Solid Oxide Cells Operated on Bio-Syngas
